channel.title: Creativebug - For Beginners
channel.description: Want to learn how to make jewelry but not sure where to start? Here you'll find easy projects and beginner techniques—the ideal starting point for newbies.

item.title: Make a Nautical Rope Bracelet
item.author: Liana Allday
item.description: Before you take off on your next beach vacation, whip up a batch of easy nautical rope bracelets. These tie-on bracelets are the perfect last-minute accessory and can be made in a snap with just a bit of rope, ribbon, leather cord and hot glue. Have fun mixing and matching your ribbon and rope to make unique pieces for all of your friends.

item.title: Make a Monkey’s Fist Knotted Necklace
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description:
Learn how to make a nautically inspired necklace using twine or decorative rope. Courtney will teach you how to create a small Monkey’s Fist Knot pendant, and then add a vibrant accent with colored cord. This is a great summertime craft for sailors and land-lovers alike.

Learn how to:
· Tie Monkey’s Fist Knot
· Add contrasting color and necklace closure
· How to make a Monkey’s Fist Knot in different sizes

item.title: Leather Wrap Bracelet
item.author: Melanie Falick
item.description: A stack of these bracelets adds understated glamour to any outfit. Melanie Falick guides you through the range of supplies and how to vary the look depending on your design choices. You will learn the mechanics of stringing the bracelet, as well as how to add more thread and make the bracelet long enough to wrap around your wrist several times.

item.title: Fabric Circles Necklace
item.author: Annabel Wrigley
item.description:
This project is a chic way to use fabric scraps – as well as mix prints with felt and neon thread. The necklace Annabel and her daughter designed is reversible, and its series of stitched lines creates a beautiful sketched quality. It makes a great beginning sewing project because of its freeform nature, and the bold finished piece adds cheer to any outfit.

What you will learn:
— Tracing and cutting circles
— Sewing fabric circles
— Assembling and sewing bib necklace

item.title: Stitched Bracelets
item.author: Annabel Wrigley
item.description: This sweet project is a quick sew that introduces simple embroidery and helps build confidence at the sewing machine. Annabel Wrigley shows how to work up these bracelets in bright colors, providing motivation for younger sewists to make and trade these bracelets with friends.

item.title: Shrinky Dink Jewelry
item.author: Nicole Blum
item.description: Create original and wearable works of art with shrinkable plastic. Nicole shows you how to take your own artwork, or use scanned images and fabric to create designs. Then watch them shrink down into miniature versions with intensely concentrated color. The magic and satisfaction works on kids of all ages!

item.title: Knotted Necklace
item.author: Natalie Chanin
item.description: This simple project gives you a hit of Natalie Chanin style without the time commitment of a typical, time-intensive Alabama Chanin project. Natalie shows you how to take strips of jersey fabric and turn them into a statement necklace that will add casual sophistication to any outfit.

item.title: Ear Wire Basics
item.author: Shana Astrachan
item.description: Buying premade ear wires is easy enough, but making your own gives you the ability to get creative with basic shapes and add custom designs to your earrings. Shana shows you techniques as well as the simple tools you will need to create three different styles. She’ll also show you how to harden the wire, and finish the end for a comfortable fit in your ear so you will have all the skills to make beautiful and strong ear wires for your earring designs.

item.title: Found Necklace
item.author: Lisa Coris
item.description: This workshop will open your eyes to the possibilities of finding necklace materials beyond the bead store. Lisa’s philosophy of creating bright, accessible jewelry shines through as she teaches you how to creatively repurpose existing necklaces along with tricks for simple strung necklaces.
